p: The air-dried fruits were ground in a laboratory mill to a size of 0.7 to 1 cm, and the twigs and leaves were cut to a size of 1 cm. The EO was isolated by hydrodistillation for 3 h in a laboratory glass apparatus of the British Pharmacopoeia modified by Balinova and Diakov [ 47]. The oil obtained was dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate and stored in tightly closed dark vials at 4 Â°C until analysis. The EO yields are represented on absolute dry weight basis.
